meanings.definition: The dry outer covering of some fruits or seeds.
meanings.sent1: She collected the husks of the sunflower seeds to use in her art project.
meanings.sent2: The farmer removed the husks from the corn before storing it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the husks of the acorns to build a tiny fort in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The husks of the coconut protected the delicious fruit inside.
meanings.sent5: The husks of the almonds were scattered on the ground, revealing the tasty nuts inside.

meanings.definition: The outer shell of corn or other grains.
meanings.sent1: The chickens pecked at the corn husks left in the field.
meanings.sent2: The husks of the wheat grains were used to make a cozy bed for the cat.
meanings.sent3: The children had a husk fight, throwing corn shells at each other.
meanings.sent4: The husks of the rice grains crunched underfoot as they walked through the field.
meanings.sent5: The farmer used the corn husks to mulch the garden, keeping the soil moist and weed-free.

meanings.definition: Worthless or discarded outer coverings or shells.
meanings.sent1: He swept the husks of the pistachio nuts off the table.
meanings.sent2: The beach was littered with husks of old crab shells.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to be pirates, using the husks of coconuts as treasure chests.
meanings.sent4: The husks of the peanuts were left behind after the squirrels had their feast.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried the husks of the popcorn bags across the park, creating a mess.
